definition: rootstock (stem onto which a branch is grafted)
tree/wood/coffin/wooden/simple/numb/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: Mulberry seedlings applicable to local growth are taken as the rootstock.
sentences.chinese: 选用适应本地生长的桑苗作砧木。

sentences.english: When apple varieties were grafted to M. hupehensis, they showed good affinity. It is, therefore, recommended as a good rootstock for apple trees.
sentences.chinese: 嫁接苹果品种亲和性好，是一个良好的苹果砧木。

sentences.english: In the rootstock sprout to leaf grafting as well.
sentences.chinese: 在砧木萌动到展叶期嫁接为好。

sentences.english: After the graft union has sealed, the upper portion of the understock is removed.
sentences.chinese: 待接口愈合之后，除去砧木的上部。

sentences.english: Potassium uptake by the grafts depends on the interaction between the stock and the scion.
sentences.chinese: 嫁接植株的吸钾特性则取决于砧木和接穗的联合效应。

sentences.english: The results showed a highly significant negative correlation between the shoot diameter of the rootstock and the electric resistance value.
sentences.chinese: 并且砧木枝条粗度与电阻值成极显著的负相关。

sentences.english: For example, a bud may develop at the junction between the scion and stock with a mixture of tissues from both.
sentences.chinese: 例如在接穗和砧木的组织混合处可以发育出新的芽。

sentences.english: The preliminary performance of Shatianyou (Citrus grandis Osbeck) on 4 types of trifoliate orange (Poncirus trifoliata Raf. )rootstock were recorded.
sentences.chinese: 比较了4个枳选系作沙田柚砧木的早期表现。

sentences.english: The leaves on different nodes of a growing shoot and different rootstocksrepresented different net photosynthetic rate.
sentences.chinese: 苹果营养枝上不同节位和砧木的叶片，净光合率不同。

sentences.english: To maintain good quality, must use grafting law breed, stock uses hill wild peach.
sentences.chinese: 为保持优良品质，必须用嫁接法繁殖，砧木用山毛桃。

sentences.english: The research results can provide a reference for the rootstock-selection in the grafting practice of M. pumila.
sentences.chinese: 本研究结果可为苹果嫁接中砧木的选择提供参考。

definition: scion (branch or bud that is grafted onto rootstock)
terminal bud (growing at the tip of a plant)
axillary bud/bud growing from axil of plant
ear (of corn or sorghum etc)/bunch (of grapes)/infructescence
vascular cambium (layer of tissue responsible for growth inside wood)
